comment: Grades are a mess on d2L nothing was due when it was supposed to. Doesn't know her own slides. S*x analogies for no reason. I would correct her exams and study guides so I could get points back. Slides don't match exams. Attempted to teach us a whole unit in a day, left for a month and showed up 30 minutes late the day of the exam. DON'T TAKE HER.

DO NOT TAKE. grading was so unclear. told students that we should "show up at 4 am if that's what it takes to be at the exam on time" and then she showed up almost 30 mins late on the next exam day. She constantly had lecture information that contradicted test material and her lectures were just reading off of PowerPoint.
She made a subject easy by giving tests only from her power points. A little bit vague on instructions though. If you study everything from the power points, you should be fine.

the class was fine but the professor was terrible and completely unorganized.. she would go back on test questions that she graded wrong for the entire class multiple times and wasn't sure of things. would not risk my college career on her at all. beware

Make sure to study the powerpoints and create quizlets over topics you need help on! Follow the structural lists since it basically covers everything you need to know for the lab exams and use PURPOSEGAMES to study locations!! Overall, this wasn't a hard class. Be organized with your studying and you'll pass. I passed with a 99% :)

Anyone who gave her a bad review clearly doesn't know how to properly study. Dr.V did a good job teaching the material to ensure you understand what's on the exam. She has study guides, so make sure you add enough detail to ensure a good grade (instead of using someone else's). I based my notes/study guides off the ppts and had a test average 89%
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Honestly, study on your own and you'll do fine. I liked her effort in showing us mnemonics or ways to remember things for lab exams. She's very nice for lab check offs, but I will say if you have a question about anything ask in class because she doesn't like emails! Overall, lab is hard in general just put in the effort and you'll be okay :)

Final exam was not 50/50 cumulative as she had said. The entire final was over unit 5 and had maybe 5 questions from the other 4 units. She makes her own exams and they have MANY errors. She does give extra credit but that's the only good thing.

This class was way harder than it needed to be. She made many errors when making tests. Also, it was difficult to be able to review your test. I went to every single lecture and they were basically pointless because she just read off slide shows and did not go into much detail. She also told students not to email her. Study guides did NOT help.

Dr.V isn't a bad professor, while she does have some flaws in her way of teaching or operating the class. It's overall not that hard if you put in the effort and study well. She provides plenty of extra credit and attendance is optional! She does respond to emails but it takes a while since her class is around 200 people. Would I take again? maybe
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: Very organized unorganized. Doesn't like/respond to emails. Only reads over slideshows doesn't actually teach or explain, I learned everything from my SI leader. Doesn't upload midterm grades. Takes points off or may even give a zero if you are 15+ minutes late to exams. Please do not chose this professor if you have other options.

Just skims the powerpoint slides without explaining it. We started unit 3 material 2 weeks before taking unit 2 exam!? Her schedule doesn't make any sense and has just given us a lecture video that wasn't helpful. The exam format/policies for each test so we don't know what to expect. Make sure your SI is good because that is how I am passing.

You basically teach yourself she only reads off the slides. Attendance isn't mandatory so I would say skip and learn yourself. You do get bonus points for going sometimes but not very necessary because there's an extra credit quiz per test. If you're good at learning by yourself go for it but if you do not, then do not recommend taking her.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. Her class is set up like a med school anatomy class- we learn a new body system every class. Doesn't teach just reads off the slides, you have to harass her to be able to review any previous exams. Was 20 minutes late to one of our exams and we only had 40 minutes to take it. you're teaching yourself the material

Don't take this professor. You will have to learn the course on your own because she flips through the slides without really explaining anything or she says "you guys can read that". She is not clear on instructions, does not communicate expectations well, but her exams are easy so you could learn everything yourself and just attend for the exam.

Unclear about expectations! Says she doesn't like emails (and rarely responds to them) and doesn't have set office hours. Covers an entire body system in 75 minutes while flipping through power points. Was out for a week and a half and came back to an exam. Doesn't seem to know the topics she is teaching. AVOID!
